reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: every thing was great , the welcome, the room , everything. There are few things that touched me deep, iphone docking station, bathrobes, biscuits , milk in a container ( not prepackded) and the delicious breakfast. another important fact is the food was all home made ( bread, biscuits, jams, juices,etc) I loved everything. will recommend to everybody
reviews.title: Like is not enough WE LOVED IT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B has only been open for a few weeks, but Alan and Angela have got absolutely everything right. There are so many little extra touches that make the stay a pleasure.
reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes, even the ones we didn't know about

reviews.text: I have stayed in many B&Bs and even more luxury hotels - this is up with the best.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked for 2 nights and stayed for 3.
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B

reviews.text: Rooms are spotless, comfortable and large.
reviews.title: Lovely bed and breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best B&B's we've stayed in, perfect location, perfect hosts, perfect food and so relaxing. We would definately recommend this to anyone. Just the right balance of hosts' welcoming manner and being left alone to explore the area and meet family & friends. Breakfast was wonderful and the veg option was great. The room treats of homemade food made the experience feel very family friendly. We will definately go there again when we are back in the area. Jacky & Ray deserve to do really well as their experience and warmth shine through from the minute they greet you to the end of the your stay.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.text: I stumbled across Timbers whilst away on business. At first, i thought I'd taken a wrong turn as I had ended up in a beautiful housing estate. To my delight, I realised this was not a mistake but a superb detached house, transformed into a B&B. Angela met me at the door and following a brief chat, showed me to my room. Unbeliveable attention to detail!!! The Bay room, which I chose to stay in is immaculately decorated, with high end fixtures and fittings, which include a huge LCD TV and a fantastic en-suite bathroom. Angela makes home made cookies and shortbread along with a decanter of sherry and hand made truffles. Right up my street! I fancied a curry that night so Angela recommended a place in town, which turned out to be pretty good. (I'm spoilt with regards to curry, as I'm from Yorkshire!) Upon my return, I met Alan. We had plenty to chat about, as we are both sports fans. I headed up to my room to finish some work id started. The king size bed was amazing and I had the best nights sleep. It was home from home in many ways. It is evident that a lot of time and thought has gone in to the detail of everything required. The morning came and my breakfast was ready right on cue. Full english,perfectly cooked with top quality ingredients. Can't beat it! People usually feel like a review as positive as this, with no negatives, isn't realistic; something I agree with. I feel it is a guests responsibilty to highlight anything such as because it helps the owners improve their business. However, I can honestly say....there is NOTHING they could've done better. As I stay away on a regular basis and have a healthy hotel budget through my company, I stay 4*-5* on most occasions. This outshines nearly every hotel I have stayed in. Seriously people, if Colchester is your destination, please stay at Timbers. You will not find anywhere better.
reviews.title: Couldn't believe my luck!!!!

reviews.text: An emergency trip to Colchester due to a family crisis was made significantly less stressful thanks to Angela and Alan at Timbers! Following a cancelled operation at Colchester hospital during which time I stayed at a well known chain of Inns directly off the A12 (which proved to be more than a little disappointing throughout), I trawled the internet extensively to find alternative accommodation...not an easy task due to the Bank Holiday weekend. Having previously paid for two nights at the aforementioned "Inn" and losing one due to the cancelled op and the need to return to work, I booked just one night at the Timbers not wanting to tempt fate (or lose more money). On arrival, Angela welcomed me by enquiring about my Mum and whether I had eaten following my long journey. I was escorted to the Oak Room which was delightfully spacious, spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated with a fabulously comfortable bed, opulent fabrics and furnishings, a lovely ensuite with luxurious toiletries, wide screen TV, scrummy biscuits, decanter of sherry, cafetiere with ground coffee (as well as the usual tea bags, sachets etc), fresh milk not to mention the most delicious homemade chocolates. Following an early morning start, I was set up for the long day ahead with the most delicious breakfast of cereal, fresh orange, lovely coffee, toast and the best Eggs Benedict I've ever had (thank you Alan), I advised Angela that if Mum's op took place that day I would need to stay in Colchester again that night. She promptly advised me that they would keep the room for me and to just give her a call when I knew what was happening which meant I could concentrate on Mum's needs without worrying... a huge relief! Thankfully the op went ahead and I did stay a second night and after a good night's sleep, enjoyed a full English breakfast the following morning - delicious! Wished I could have stayed under less stressful circumstances but wouldn't have wanted to be anywhere else during a difficult time! So thankful I found the Timbers and definitely hope to go again although I suspect given the excellent reviews it might be fully booked! Exceptional! Thank you Angela and Alan x
reviews.title: Timbers B&B...Colchester's best kept secret!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a really lovely bed & breakfast. Angela and Alan were really friendly and helpful. The room was beautifully decorated and had everything we could want, the little extras like the truffles and biscuits made it special. Breakfast was fantastic, I loved the waffles and the fruit salad with homemade yoghurt, and it was great to have so much choice. The bed & breakfast is in a lovely quiet road on the outskirts of Colchester with plenty of space to park and easy to get to. We would highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Fantastic Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relaxing very nice bed and breakfast. Spotless, King size bed. Bathrobes, homemade biscuits, tea and coffee in room. Soap, shampoo, shower gel and large bath sheets. Homemade bread, brown and white, yoghurt etc. Top glass breakfast, full english, salmon or haddock, cereals, fresh fruit, no need to eat for the rest of the day. Very nice quiet rd and very nice couple run it. He is a chef. We would go back again.
reviews.title: Brilliant for piece and quiet and relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've said in previous reviews that we've stayed in places that are difficult to fault; Timbers is different...we can't fault it at all! You aren't so much staying in a 'guesthouse', you are Angela and Alan's guests. There's a subtle difference. Friendly and interested; nothing is too much trouble for them. Recommendations on where to eat (and booking a table for us and then providing a lift); what to see; all spot on.
reviews.title: Faultless B&B

reviews.text: This is how a B&B should be run.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.text: No expense has been spared and the rooms are equipped to the highest standard. There's everything you could want. Cleanliness is not just good; it's immaculate. Breakfast was amazing.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: As you may have gathered: we cannot speak highly enough about Timbers...so much so that we're running out of superlatives! Why it's Number 3 in Colchester's B&Bs is quite beyond us: we can't think how it could be bettered...should be Number 1.
reviews.title: Luxurious, quiet and comfortable

reviews.text: Angela and Alan were perfect hosts. I turned up at around half 7 and was greeted by Angela and Alan who took my bags to my room to let me get settled. Angela then asked if I'd like a pot of tea in their living room and brought me not only the tea but a slice of cake to go with it. They happily sat and chatted to me which was lovely and very informal. I felt completely comfortable and content. The next morning, breakfast was excellent. I had eggs Benedict and I'm very particular about getting them right so Alan did a fine job. I have already booked to stay again for business. It was a home from home.
reviews.title: Lovely little touches
